Text.Value: He may be a fool and a braggart, but it seems this Lorroakan is a toad of action, too.
No - you'd be busy day and night if you took as your own the enemies of Me.
Your manners belie your words. There cannot be secrets betwixt us - not ones like this.
You ought to have revealed this plot before. What if a hair on darling Isobel's head had been harmed?
Still, allies we are, and allies we remain. Let us unite us against the deviant plot of this mad mage.
You ought to have revealed this plot before; aye, I would have slept with both eyes open wide.
I found a note on one of the foes - it read of the wizard Lorroakan and his designs upon my capture.
I would have told you if I'd known you were in trouble.
Whatever Lorroakan's plot, we will find and destroy him.

EditorData.logicalname: Player does not know Lorroa plan

Text.Value: Let us hie us to his chambers, his lair, when morning breaks. We will see him undone in the style of the dead, unburied Ketheric Thorm.
I found a note on one of the foes - it read of the wizard Lorroakan, high up in Ramazith's Tower, and his designs upon my capture.
To Ramazith's Tower they were meant to take me. Ho! Won't Lorroakan be surprised when Dame Aylin trounces him in his own citadel.
I knew Lorroakan wanted to capture you, yes.
A most unwelcome surprise. But we shan't be caught out again.
I'm just as surprised as you are.

EditorData.logicalname: Player does not know Lorroa plan

Text.Value: I did. I should have told you.
Dame Aylin will face him. You will wield your glorious might at her side. Let us split him, crotch to crown, and let his twin halves fall where they may.
Our camp has been besieged by bribelings. And Dame Aylin is the prize that seduced them.
I wish to forgive this lapse in your fealty - for we must face the cad together.
Don't count on me to track every vendetta you've accrued.

EditorData.logicalname: Player does not know Lorroa plan

Text.Value: Finish your night's rest, then meet me in Ramazith's Tower. We will finish this together.
But it is too late for 'why's and 'what if's. Now the conspiracy has been revealed.
It was as you foretold: the villain Lorroakan seeks to retrieve me, body and soul.
I wish to forgive this lapse in your fealty, though it won't be the first. I pray I am not mistaken in my presumption of your good will.
There can be no doubt about it. But even Dame Aylin experiences lapses in her fine judgement.
Allies we are, and allies we remain, and we will unite us against the deviant plot of this mad mage.
Prove me right. Fight alongside me against a mad mage one more time.
Tell me, ally mine: did you know of this plot?

Synopsis: Nightsong's dialogue after Aradin attacks the Camp and is repelled.
